verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Maskil of the sons of Korah.) As the deer<WH354> pants<WH6165> for the water<WH4325> brooks,<WH650> So<WH3651> my soul<WH5315> pants<WH6165> for Thee, O God.<WH430>
My soul<WH5315> thirsts<WH6770> for God,<WH430> for the living<WH2416> God;<WH410> When<WH4970> shall I come<WH935> and appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> God<WH430>?
My tears<WH1832> have been<WH1961> my food<WH3899> day<WH3119> and night,<WH3915> While [they] say<WH559> to me all<WH3605> day<WH3117> long, "Where<WH346> is your God<WH430>?"

These<WH428> things<WH428> I remember,<WH2142> and I pour<WH8210> out my soul<WH5315> within<WH5921> me. For I used to go<WH5674> along<WH5674> with the throng<WH5519> [and] lead<WH1718> them in procession<WH1718> to the house<WH1004> of God,<WH430> With the voice<WH6963> of joy<WH7440> and thanksgiving,<WH8426> a multitude<WH1995> keeping<WH2287> festival.<WH2287>

Why<WH4100> are you in despair,<WH7817> O my soul<WH5315>? And [why] have you become<WH1993> disturbed<WH1993> within<WH5921> me? Hope<WH3176> in God,<WH430> for I shall again<WH5750> praise<WH3034> Him [For] the help<WH3444> of His presence.<WH6440>

O my God,<WH430> my soul<WH5315> is in despair<WH7817> within<WH5921> me; Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> I remember<WH2142> Thee from the land<WH776> of the Jordan,<WH3383> And the peaks of Hermon,<WH2769> from Mount<WH2022> Mizar.<WH4706>
Deep<WH8415> calls<WH7121> to deep<WH8415> at the sound<WH6963> of Thy waterfalls;<WH6794> All<WH3605> Thy breakers<WH4867> and Thy waves<WH1530> have rolled<WH5674> over<WH5921> me.

The Lord<WH3068> will command<WH6680> His lovingkindness<WH2617> in the daytime;<WH3119> And His song<WH7892> will be with me in the night,<WH3915> A prayer<WH8605> to the God<WH410> of my life.<WH9132>
I will say<WH559> to God<WH410> my rock,<WH5553> "Why<WH4100> hast Thou forgotten<WH7911> me? Why<WH4100> do I go<WH1980> mourning<WH6937> because of the oppression<WH3906> of the enemy<WH340>?"
As a shattering<WH7524> of my bones,<WH6106> my adversaries<WH6887> revile<WH2778> me, While they say<WH559> to me all<WH3605> day<WH3117> long, "Where<WH346> is your God<WH430>?"

Why<WH4100> are you in despair,<WH7817> O my soul<WH5315>? And why<WH4100> have you become<WH1993> disturbed<WH1993> within<WH5921> me? Hope<WH3176> in God,<WH430> for I shall yet<WH5750> praise<WH3034> Him, The help<WH3444> of my countenance,<WH6440> and my God.<WH430>
